verses.verse: Now there was a famine <WH7458> in the land, <WH776> besides <WH4480> <WH905> the previous <WH7223> famine <WH7458> that had occurred <WH1961> in the days <WH3117> of Abraham. <WH85> So Isaac <WH3327> went <WH1980> to Gerar, <WH1642> to Abimelech <WH40> king <WH4428> of the Philistines. <WH6430>
And the Lord <WH3068> appeared <WH7200> to him and said, <WH559> "Do not go <WH3381> down <WH3381> to Egypt; <WH4714> stay <WH7931> in the land <WH776> of which <WH834> I shall tell <WH559> you.

"Sojourn <WH1481> in this <WH2088> land <WH776> and I will be with you and bless <WH1288> you, for to you and to your descendants <WH2233> I will give <WH5414> all <WH3605> these <WH411> lands, <WH776> and I will establish <WH6965> the oath <WH7621> which <WH834> I swore <WH7650> to your father Abraham. <WH1>

"And I will multiply <WH7235> your descendants <WH2233> as the stars <WH3556> of heaven, <WH8064> and will give <WH5414> your descendants <WH2233> all <WH3605> these <WH411> lands; <WH776> and by your descendants <WH2233> all <WH3605> the nations <WH1471> of the earth <WH776> shall be blessed; <WH1288>
because <WH6118> <WH834> Abraham <WH85> obeyed <WH8085> <WH6963> Me and kept <WH8104> My charge, <WH4931> My commandments, <WH4687> My statutes <WH2708> and My laws. <WH8451> "
So Isaac <WH3327> lived <WH3427> in Gerar. <WH1642>

When the men <WH376> of the place <WH4725> asked <WH7592> about his wife, <WH802> he said, <WH559> "She is my sister, <WH269>" for he was afraid <WH3372> to say, <WH559> "my wife, <WH802>" [thinking,] "the men <WH376> of the place <WH4725> might kill <WH2026> me on account <WH5921> of Rebekah, <WH7259> for she is beautiful. <WH2896>"

And it came <WH1961> about, when <WH3588> he had been there <WH8033> a long <WH748> time, <WH3117> that Abimelech <WH40> king <WH4428> of the Philistines <WH6430> looked <WH8259> out through <WH1157> a window, <WH2474> and saw, <WH7200> and behold, <WH2009> Isaac <WH3327> was caressing <WH6711> his wife <WH802> Rebekah. <WH7259>

Then Abimelech <WH40> called <WH7121> Isaac <WH3327> and said, <WH559> "Behold, <WH2009> certainly <WH389> she is your wife! <WH802> How <WH349> then did you say, <WH559> 'She is my sister <WH269>'?" And Isaac <WH3327> said <WH559> to him, "Because <WH3588> I said, <WH559> 'Lest <WH6435> I die <WH4191> on account <WH5921> of her.'"

And Abimelech <WH40> said, <WH559> "What <WH4100> is this <WH2088> you have done <WH6213> to us? One <WH259> of the people <WH5971> might easily <WH4592> have lain <WH7901> with your wife, <WH802> and you would have brought <WH935> guilt <WH817> upon us."

So Abimelech <WH40> charged <WH6680> all <WH3605> the people, <WH5971> saying, <WH559> "He who touches <WH5060> this <WH2088> man <WH376> or his wife <WH802> shall surely <WH4191> be put <WH4191> to death. <WH4191>"
Now Isaac <WH3327> sowed <WH2232> in that land, <WH776> and reaped <WH4672> in the same <WH1931> year <WH8141> a hundredfold. <WH3967> <WH8180> And the Lord <WH3068> blessed <WH1288> him,
and the man <WH376> became <WH1431> rich, <WH1431> and continued <WH1980> to grow <WH1432> richer <WH1432> until <WH5704> he became <WH1431> very <WH3966> wealthy; <WH1431>
for he had <WH1961> possessions <WH4735> of flocks <WH6629> and herds <WH1241> and a great <WH7227> household, <WH5657> so that the Philistines <WH6430> envied <WH7065> him.

Now all <WH3605> the wells <WH875> which <WH834> his father's servants <WH1> had dug <WH5650> in the days <WH2658> of Abraham <WH3117> his father, the Philistines <WH85> stopped <WH6430> up by filling <WH5640> them with earth. <WH4390>
Then Abimelech <WH40> said <WH559> to Isaac, <WH3327> "Go <WH1980> away from us, for you are too <WH3966> powerful <WH6105> for us."
And Isaac <WH3327> departed <WH1980> from there <WH8033> and camped <WH2583> in the valley <WH5158> of Gerar, <WH1642> and settled <WH3427> there. <WH8033>

Then Isaac <WH3327> dug <WH2658> again <WH7725> the wells <WH875> of water <WH4325> which <WH834> had been dug <WH2658> in the days <WH3117> of his father Abraham, <WH1> for the Philistines <WH85> had stopped <WH6430> them up after <WH5640> the death <WH310> of Abraham; <WH4194> and he gave <WH85> them the same <WH7121> names <WH8034> which <WH8034> his father had given <WH834> them.
But when Isaac's servants <WH5650> dug <WH2658> in the valley <WH5158> and found <WH4672> there <WH8033> a well <WH875> of flowing <WH2416> water, <WH4325>

the herdsmen <WH7462> of Gerar <WH1642> quarreled <WH7378> with the herdsmen <WH7462> of Isaac, <WH3327> saying, <WH559> "The water <WH4325> is ours!" So he named <WH7121> <WH8034> the well <WH875> Esek, <WH6230> because <WH3588> they contended <WH6229> with him.
Then they dug <WH2658> another <WH312> well, <WH875> and they quarreled <WH7378> over <WH5921> it too, <WH1571> so he named <WH7121> <WH8034> it Sitnah. <WH7856>

And he moved <WH6275> away <WH6275> from there <WH8033> and dug <WH2658> another <WH312> well, <WH875> and they did not quarrel <WH7378> over <WH5921> it; so he named <WH7121> <WH8034> it Rehoboth, <WH7344> for he said, <WH559> "At last <WH3588> <WH6258> the Lord <WH3068> has made <WH7337> room <WH7337> for us, and we shall be fruitful <WH6509> in the land. <WH776>"
Then he went <WH5927> up from there <WH8033> to Beersheba. <WH884>

And the Lord <WH3068> appeared <WH7200> to him the same <WH1931> night <WH3915> and said, <WH559> "I am the God <WH430> of your father Abraham; <WH1> Do not fear, <WH85> for I am with you. I will bless <WH3372> you, and multiply <WH1288> your descendants, <WH7235> For the sake <WH2233> of My servant <WH5668> Abraham. <WH5650>"

So he built <WH1129> an altar <WH4196> there, <WH8033> and called <WH7121> upon the name <WH8034> of the Lord, <WH3068> and pitched <WH5186> his tent <WH168> there; <WH8033> and there <WH8033> Isaac's servants <WH5650> dug <WH3738> a well. <WH875>
Then Abimelech <WH40> came <WH1980> to him from Gerar <WH1642> with his adviser <WH4828> Ahuzzath, <WH276> and Phicol <WH6369> the commander <WH8269> of his army. <WH6635>
And Isaac <WH3327> said <WH559> to them, "Why <WH4069> have you come <WH935> to me, since you hate <WH8130> me, and have sent <WH7971> me away <WH7971> from you?"

And they said, <WH559> "We see <WH7200> plainly <WH7200> that the Lord <WH3068> has been <WH1961> with you; so we said, <WH559> 'Let there now <WH4994> be an oath <WH423> between <WH996> us, [even] between <WH996> you and us, and let us make <WH3772> a covenant <WH1285> with you,

that you will do <WH6213> us no <WH518> harm, <WH9567> just <WH9201> as we have not touched <WH5060> you and have done <WH6213> to you nothing <WH7534> but good, <WH9185> and have sent <WH7971> you away <WH7971> in peace. <WH7965> You are now <WH6258> the blessed <WH1288> of the Lord. <WH3068>' "
Then he made <WH6213> them a feast, <WH4960> and they ate <WH398> and drank. <WH8354>

And in the morning <WH1242> they arose <WH7925> early <WH7925> and exchanged <WH7650> oaths; <WH7650> then Isaac <WH3327> sent <WH7971> them away <WH7971> and they departed <WH1980> from him in peace. <WH7965>

Now it came <WH1961> about on the same <WH1931> day, <WH3117> that Isaac's servants <WH5650> came <WH935> in and told <WH5046> him about <WH5921> <WH182> the well <WH875> which <WH834> they had dug, <WH2658> and said <WH559> to him, "We have found <WH4672> water. <WH4325>"
So he called <WH7121> it Shibah; <WH7656> therefore <WH5921> <WH3651> the name <WH8034> of the city <WH5892> is Beersheba <WH884> to this <WH2088> day. <WH3117>

And when Esau <WH6215> was forty <WH705> years <WH8141> old <WH1121> he married <WH3947> <WH802> Judith <WH3067> the daughter <WH1323> of Beeri <WH882> the Hittite, <WH2850> and Basemath <WH1315> the daughter <WH1323> of Elon <WH356> the Hittite; <WH2850>
and they brought <WH1961> grief <WH4786> <WH7307> to Isaac <WH3327> and Rebekah. <WH7259>
